page.title: 08Mr. Levi Shepherd
page.content: {Mr. Levi Shepherd}was born in Charlestown on 23rd September 1895. He has lived at Fern Villas for 84 years. Levi had 11 brothers and sisters but two died young. He went to Mytholm School when he was 5 years old, and wore knickerbockers, woolly socks and jumpers. School cost 2p per week but later went down to a penny. There were 80 children in the school. He played football, cricket, hop skip and jump, touch'n'go, marbles and paper chase. He learnt the ABC, subtraction, sat at long desks with tip up seats and wrote on a slate with a pencil. He left school at 12 yrs old becoming an errand boy at Callis Mill then a weaver, which he disliked, then a jockey and a soldier in the first World war.
